channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Redditor up 25% after boldly taking out $59K worth of personal loans to buy BTC
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: So far they have accrued 2.65 BTC at an average price well under the current level of around $30,000 for 1 BTC.

item.title: Investors still waiting on $1.9M refund Logan Paul promised six months ago: CoffeeZilla
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: Coffezilla asserted that the refund process should be quite easy to sort while the financial implications aren't an issue for someone as wealthy as Logan Paul.

item.title: FedNow “early adopter” list contains no blockchains, but some may integrate later
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: Two blockchain networks had previously announced integration with the Fed’s instant payment service, but they were not found on a new list of certified providers.

item.title: Crypto ATM firm Bitcoin Depot will go public on Nasdaq starting July 3
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: The special purpose acquisition company deal, first reported in August 2022, cost $885 million and is expected to allow investors exposure to Bitcoin Depot’s common stock.

item.title: Crypto Biz: Binance’s chaotic June, miners gear up for halving, Bitfinex’s Latam expansion
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: This week’s Crypto Biz looks at the story behind Binance’s debanking in Australia, Bitcoin miners preparing for the next halving, and Bitfinex’s expansion in Latin America.

item.title: $656M lost from crypto hacks, scams and rug pulls in H1 2023: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Approximately $215 million of stolen assets have since been recovered.

item.title: Over $204M lost to DeFi hacks and scams in Q2: Finance Redefined
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: The top 100 DeFi tokens didn’t see much change in price over the past week, with the majority posting minor weekly gains.

item.title: Polygon proposes architecture for ‘Polygon 2.0,' including aggregator bridge
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The forthcoming multichain system will use zk proofs to transfer assets between networks.

item.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.category: why did the Fed pause rates
item.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

item.title: Crypto VC is struggling only from a North American perspective — Animoca Brands CEO
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Speaking with Cointelegraph at the Collision conference in Toronto, crypto veteran Yat Siu outlined how crypto firms can cope with unique environments, stressing that it is not “as bad as it sounds.”

item.title: South Korean crypto lending firm Delio under investigation by regulators
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The firm allegedly denied having any exposure to troubled sister lending firm Haru Invest before suspending transfers earlier this month.

item.title: Crypto mass adoption is coming, but how fast?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marco Castrovilli
item.description: The latest Cointelegraph Report assesses the current growth rate of global cryptocurrency usage and tries to predict when crypto will reach mass adoption.

item.title: Don’t be naive — BlackRock's ETF won't be bullish for Bitcoin
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ben Caselin
item.description: Are regulators trying to disarm crypto-native companies in order to pave the way for Blackrock to steamroll the industry?

item.title: US SEC deems spot Bitcoin ETFs filings as inadequate: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: In the eyes of the SEC, the recent filings from BlackRock, ARK Invest, Fidelity and other asset managers are not “sufficiently clear and comprehensive.”

item.title: Bitcoin ‘overreacting’ as SEC returns ETF filings, BTC price dives 6%
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin ETF applications need refiling, the SEC says, but as BTC price dips to $29,500, markets instantly fear that the fight is over.

item.title: What is the International Monetary Fund, and how does it work?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Alice Ivey
item.description: Explore the IMF’s objectives, governance structure and key functions in promoting global financial stability.

item.title: Universities use blockchain-based storage to protect and democratize data
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rachel Wolfson
item.description: Decentralized solutions can make academic research more secure and more accessible.

item.title: NFT Collector: Snoop’s NFT nostalgia, The Goose draws Gen Y to Sotheby’s
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Greg Oakford
item.description: Snoop Dogg’s NFT passport is a blueprint for concert merch of the future, Sotheby’s NFT VP says The Goose drew Millennials to auction house.

item.title: Will BlackRock’s ETF slingshot Bitcoin’s price skyward?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Andrew Singer
item.description: Have the world’s largest financial firms finally “seen the light” with Bitcoin? Will demand outstrip supply, making a BTC price rise inevitable?

item.title: Web3 mass adoption: How Web3 can onboard the next billion users
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Wolfgang Rückerl
item.description: By conquering these hurdles, we can help kickstart mass adoption while still maintaining the original decentralized spirit of Web3.

item.title: ZkDay comes to Paris on July 19: A marquee ZK conference amid EthCC
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph
item.description: The ZK-focused community conference zkDay Paris kicks off on July 19 during EthCC after a successful event in Denver.

item.title: Challenges Web3 developers encounter when using chatbots like ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Vinita Rathi
item.description: So, if you still haven’t jumped on the chatbot bandwagon, it could be high time you consider exploring the possibilities.

item.title: Revolut US to delist ADA, MATIC and SOL in September
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: Crypto-friendly neobank Revolut has halted purchases of Cardano, Polygon and Solana for U.S. customers, but holding and selling remains available until mid-September.

item.title: Why approving a Bitcoin ETF might unleash $18B in sell-pressure
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Grayscale Bitcoin Trust conversion to an ETF will unlock a potential sale of up to $18 billion in Bitcoin.

item.title: The world’s biggest Bitcoin conferences: Decentralize with Cointelegraph
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Joe Hall
item.description: What do thought leaders at the world’s largest Bitcoin conferences make of Bitcoin in 2023? This week’s Decentralize with Cointelegraph podcast focuses on Bitcoin 2023 in Miami and BTC Prague.

item.title: The EU’s AI regulations sparked a letter signed by 160 tech execs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: As the EU works on its upcoming AI bill, executives from 160 companies in the industry drafted an open letter on the implications of too-strict regulations.

item.title: SEC to present response to Coinbase’s legal defense on July 13
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: The court also rescheduled the pre-trial conference to a pre-motion conference, shifting it to July 13 from its original date of Aug. 24.

item.title: South Korea passes cryptocurrency bill to tackle unfair trading
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: South Korea’s crypto bill aims to establish a basis for imposing penalties and liability for damages caused by unfair cryptocurrency trading.

item.title: What are blue-chip NFTs, and how to find them?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Onkar Singh
item.description: Blue-chip NFTs refer to highly valuable and prestigious nonfungible tokens that are considered top-tier assets within the NFT market.

item.title: US senator pushes tech companies to label AI-generated content
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: United States Senator Michael Bennet wrote a letter to major tech companies, including OpenAI and Google, to urge the labeling of AI-generated content.
